title: Font of Sagmeister's new book
content:
Hello! I’m new at Typophile, and I would like to know if any of you know, witch font did Stephan Sagmeister used for the text on his very new book “Things I have learned in my life”.

I don’t have a picture right now but I will post it as soon as I can.

Thanks.

 [‹ GE Money Typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012182104/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43939 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Stormspell" Gothic-looking logo - hand drawn {Lex} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012182104/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43873 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ping-Ponger

comments.content: I just saw that book at MoMA but didn’t notice the font.

Sorry, I tried to do a search before but there were no results. As you know, I’m new here.

Althout in the other post they are discussing another typeface. I was asking for the typeface that he used on the body text. Thank you anyway.

You can see low-resolution pictures [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012182104/http:/search.barnesandnoble.com/booksearch/isbninquiry.asp?r=1&ean=0810995298), but from them I can only tell that the display type in the book is the same as the one on the website.

Scanning or taking a picture of the body text would help.
